special:
The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:
When upgrading, users should be aware of the following:
- In Ubuntu 11.04, unity-2d users may lose the ability to view drop-down menus,
context menus, and perform drag-and-drop operations in Firefox. This is a known
issue being tracked in https://launchpad.net/bugs/1020198 and may be fixed in a
later update.
After a standard system update you need to restart Firefox to make
all the necessary changes.
threat: If the user were tricked into opening a  specially crafted page, an attacker could possibly exploit these to cause a  denial of service via application crash, or potentially execute code with the  privileges of the user invoking Firefox.
An attacker could exploit this  to conduct phishing attacks.

If the  user were tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could  possibly exploit these to cause a denial of service via application crash, or  potentially execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox.
A remote attacker  could exploit this to conduct phishing attacks.
A remote attacker could exploit this to  conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks via javascript execution in the HTML  feed view.

If the user were  tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could possibly  exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially  execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox.
If the user were tricked into opening a specially  crafted page, an attacker could possibly exploit this to execute code with the  privileges of the user invoking Firefox.
If the user were tricked into opening a specially  crafted color profile, an attacker could possibly exploit this to cause a  denial of service via application crash.
An attacker could exploit this to conduct  clickjacking attacks.

If the user were  tricked into opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could possibly  exploit this to cause a denial of service via application crash, or potentially  execute code with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox.
If the user were tricked into  opening a specially crafted page, an attacker could possibly exploit this to  access a user's OAuth 2.0 access tokens and OpenID credentials.
A remote attacker could trick a user into accepting a malicious  certificate via a crafted certificate warning page.
If the user were tricked into opening a specially crafted URL, an  attacker could possibly exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS)  attacks.
If the user  were tricked into opening a specially crafted URL, an attacker could possibly  exploit this to conduct cross-site scripting (XSS) attacks.
A remote attacker could exploit this to execute code  with the privileges of the user invoking Firefox.
